title: Bug 4964: Automatic Code Assist needs to be smarter
description: Since DISPOSED is first in the list and is selected, I ended up with: button.DISPOSED which isn't even close to what I want, and I have to delete it all and start again, paying more attention this time. Code assist should notice that I have typed a ( and that this matches 'dispose()' far better than 'DISPOSED'. Either that, or it needs to be case sensitive when it is automatically inserting stuff.
OB: When using the code assist feature, the system incorrectly suggests 'DISPOSED' instead of the expected 'dispose()' method. As a result, the generated code is incorrect and needs to be manually corrected.
EB: The code assist feature should be improved to intelligently suggest the relevant methods based on the context. In this case, it should prioritize suggesting 'dispose()' instead of 'DISPOSED' when the user types '('. Alternatively, the code assist feature should be case sensitive when automatically inserting code.
SR:
To reproduce the issue, follow these steps:
1. Open the code editor.
2. Type a '(' character.
3. Observe the code assist suggestions.
4. Note that 'DISPOSED' is suggested instead of 'dispose()'.
5. Delete the incorrect suggestion and start again.
